name: Clock multiplier
description:
This algorithm is a simple clock multiplier, generating a faster clock from a slower one.
The output clock rate is updated on every clock received, except that the clock duration is limited to at
most double each time. This is mainly to prevent the output clock rate changing when the input clock
is paused and restarted, which would otherwise be interpreted as a really long clock pulse.

parameters.name: ES-5 Expander
parameters.description: If set, the ES-5 expander header to use for output instead of the bus specified by the Output parameter. "1" means the ES-5 itself.

parameters.name: ES-5 Output
parameters.description: If using an ES-5 expander output, sets which of the 8 outputs on the expander to use.

input_ports.name: Output mode
input_ports.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

input_ports.name: Low voltage
input_ports.description: The output voltage when the clock is low/inactive.

input_ports.name: High voltage
input_ports.description: The output voltage when the clock is high/active.
